title: Bug 21706: Issue with Class.forName() Usage in BidiUtil on Win32
description: This bug report concerns the usage of 'Class.forName()' in BidiUtil on the Win32 platform.
OB: The bug report does not provide specific observed behavior.
EB: The expected behavior should involve adding a private constructor to the BidiUtil class. Given that there are no non-static methods in this class, adding a private constructor is recommended as it prevents unnecessary class instantiation. This change won't increase the size since the compiler automatically provides a public constructor. It simply changes the constructor from public to private to prevent instantiation.
SR: To address the bug, follow the suggested code change by adding a private constructor to the BidiUtil class. Additionally, you can modify the line of code: 'static Callback callback = new Callback (BidiUtil.class, 'windowProc', 4);' to 'static Callback callback = new Callback (new BidiUtil().getClass(), 'windowProc', 4);'. Please note that testing is required to confirm that this change resolves the issue.
